The webpage for the third annual Samurai Fiction contest is now live:
http:=
//www.samurai-archives.com/writcon2.html

This year, I'm sticking with the =
genres idea, with the addition that
this year, for every 5 stories entered,=
 I will add an additional $50
to the prize winnings - so it is in all the e=
ntrants best interest to
try to get as many people to join as possible.  Al=
so, between now and
September 15th, the entry fee is only $7 - it will go u=
p to $10 after
that.  Below is a general description of the details, howeve=
r, check
the webpage noted above for more detailed information:

Third Annu=
al Samurai Fiction Contest, 2007

The parameters for the third annual Samur=
ai Fiction contest are
covered on this page. The stories must involve Japan=
 or the Samurai,
and the story may take place any time up to, but no later =
than the end
of the 19th century, and may take place at any point in Japane=
se
history before this.

 

Requirements:

This is to be a piece of fiction=
 writing taking place within an
unspecified period in Japanese history up t=
o the late 19th century.
The available genres are listed below, or along th=
e window on the left
of this page - the stories must be written in the styl=
e of one of the
genres on the listed.

Parameters:

The story is required t=
o be more than 1,000 words, with a 5,000 word
targeted limit - overages are=
 acceptable if necessary, but please
don't overdo it. It can be done in the=
 first person, or the third
person, and must be a complete short story, not=
 an excerpt from a
larger story. The genre(s) must be listed at the top of =
the story
above the title - one genre or a combination of two genres are
ac=
ceptable. Although the particular genre will not affect judging, all
entran=
ts must make sure that their story follows the requirements of
their chosen=
 genre(s) - see details below.

Sequels: Sequels to previous stories entere=
d in the contest are
acceptable - however, the story must be a stand-alone =
short story, not
a continuation of the previous story.

Entrance Fee and Pr=
ize Details:

The entrance fee depends on when you sign up for the contest:=


The current fee is $7

If you sign up for the contest between September 1=
6th and December
31st, 2006, the fee will be $10.

If you sign up for the c=
ontest between January 1st and the deadline of
March 31st, 2007, the fee wi=
ll be $15.

So it is to your advantage to sign up early.

Additionally, for=
 every five entries, the Samurai Archives will add
$50 to the winnings.

Th=
e fee is payable via PAYPAL (www.paypal.com), payable to: webmaster
@ samur=
ai-archives.com. Be sure to include your full name, and Yahoo
ID, Samurai A=
rchives Citadel ID, and Delphi Forums ID (please list any
and all that you =
have, omit any you don't - this is so we can keep
track of entries) when yo=
u pay the entrance fee, and note that the
payment is for the 2007 Samurai F=
iction contest. You will receive a
confirmation email that your submission =
has been received.
Why an entrance fee? Because the winner of the contest w=
ill win 80% of
the total sum of all fees collected, the runner up will win =
the
remaining 20%. Additionally, as stated before, for every 5 entries,
the=
 Samurai Archives will add an additional $50 to the total winnings.
Note: E=
ntrance fees are non-refundable, so if you pay the fee, be sure
to send in =
a story, as the fees will stay as part of the total the
winner will receive=
.
If you do not have a credit card or paypal account but still want to
ente=
r, please send an email to webmaster @ samurai-archives.com about
sending a=
 money order.

Submission Information:

Submissions are to be sent via emai=
l to webmaster @
samurai-archives.com in a WORD .Doc format OR HTML. At the=
 top of the
first page, please include your full name, your Yahoo ID, Samur=
ai
Archives Citadel ID, and your Delphi Forums ID (whichever is
applicable)=
 so it can be matched with your entrance fee, as well as
the genre(s) the s=
tory falls under, and the title of your story. You
will receive a confirmat=
ion email that your submission has been received.

Judging and Winning the =
contest:

Submissions will be judged by a panel of Yahoo Group and Samurai
=
Citadel community members who are not submitting stories. The judges
will n=
ot be told who the authors of each respective submision are
until after the=
 judging has closed, to avoid any swaying of the
judges. The recipient of t=
he submissions (The Samurai Archives
webmaster) will not be a judge, and wi=
ll only moderate the
proceedings, to keep entries anonymous. The winner wil=
l receive the
total of all collected entrance fees, and the winning story w=
ill be
featured on the Samurai Archives site as the winner of the 2007
Samu=
rai Fiction contest. All stories will be placed in the 'Fan
Fiction' sectio=
n of the Samurai Archives as well. The winner will be
announced at the Yaho=
o Group and the Samurai Citadel at the end of
judging. 

Deadline for entra=
nce fee: 3/31/2007
Deadline for fiction submission: 4/05/2007
Judging start=
s: 4/10/2007
Judging ends: 4/15/2007 or until necessary
Winner to be announ=
ced after judging.

Timelines are subject to change. 

See the website here=
 for more details:

http://www.samurai-archives.com/writcon2.html
